name: Jewish Mythology
tagline: The Covenant People and Divine Torah
description: Explore Jewish sacred narratives of covenant, Torah, exile and return, and mystical Kabbalah.
overview: Jewish mythology encompasses the covenantal relationship between the one God (YHWH/Adonai) and the Jewish people Israel. Core narratives include: Creation and Eden, the Patriarchs (Abraham, Isaac, Jacob), Exodus from Egypt, Sinai revelation of Torah, conquest of Canaan, Davidic kingdom, Babylonian Exile, return and Second Temple, destruction and diaspora. Jewish mysticism (Kabbalah) developed elaborate cosmology of sefirot (divine emanations), Ein Sof (infinite God), and tikkun olam (world repair). The tradition emphasizes: strict monotheism, chosen people status through covenant not superiority, Torah study and mitzvot (commandments), Sabbath observance, messiah expectation, and repair of the world.

sections.title: The Covenant
sections.body:
**Covenant with Abraham:** God promises descendants, land (Canaan), and blessing to all nations through Abraham's lineage.

**Covenant at Sinai:** Torah (Law) given to Moses. Israel becomes YHWH's treasured people through obedience to commandments.

**Davidic Covenant:** Promise of eternal throne through David's line - foundation of messianic expectation.

Covenant creates mutual obligations: God protects and blesses Israel; Israel follows Torah and worships God alone.
